title: Ticket #7214: Signal handler can create daemon log owned by root
description:
The code to write to the daemon's log file safely from a signal handler can end up creating the file with root ownership. This will prevent any new instances of the daemon from writing to the file. Due to a short-circuiting OR operator, a call to seteuid() is likely to be skipped in safe_async_log_open().

We saw this occur in CHTC under the following circumstances:

  • The starter's log was moved to another directory (by third-party log rotation software) while the daemon was running.
  • The starter called EXCEPT() while in root privilege (in the docker_proc job reaper).
  • ABORT_ON_EXCEPTION was set to True in the Condor config files.
